p: Acclimation temperature had no effect on burst performance in X. laevis, which is congruent with some other studies on burst performance in this species ( Miller and Zoghby, 1986). However, prior studies showed contradictory results for acclimation at low temperature (10 or 12Â°C) with one study demonstrating an effect and the other not ( Wilson et al., 2000 versus Miller and Zoghby, 1986). As previous studies have demonstrated that early embryonic development can impact the ability of animals to acclimate at the tadpole stage ( Seebacher and Grigaltchik, 2015), it would be of interest to test whether these effects are passed on to the adult stage. Similarly, it would be of interest to test whether exposure to different temperatures at the tadpole stage impacts the ability of adults to acclimate to different temperatures. If so, then this could explain contrasting results between these studies on thermal acclimation.
